page.title: 16BIRDWATCHING ON THE MOORLAND
page.content: The Rochdale Field Natualist Society, who have records of all bird sightings in the area, have been very excited this year for two reasons. Firstly, at the northern end of Piethorne reservoir Canada Geese have produced offspring for the first time.With the draining of nearby Hollingworth Lake a pair arrived at Piethorne and have produced five goslings this year. In the coniferous woodland on the north-western side of Piethorne there are a pair of long eared owls nesting.This is the first time ever in the area that this has happened. Needless to say a watch was kept on the site to ensure that the eggs were safe from theft.
